I think we have found our new spot for our annual dinner.

Excellent food and the drinks were perfect. Really enjoyed the ambiance and liveliness. Our server was very attentive, and seemed to enjoy his job. Wish we had room to try their desserts, but we both were stuffed. Would highly recommend

It is hard for me to find a place that hits on all marks but this place did it. 

Service was fantastic, food was great, and ambiance was great. The menu had the perfect selection, variety of options, and everyone in our large group was happy. 

I was also impressed to see that their coffee is served with a French press.

Can't say enough about this place.

One of locals best kept secrets. If your looking to get away from the strip and jump into a south beach Florida atmosphere then head to this place.  Many local celebrities can be seen here on any given day, and for good reason. Great place to enjoy some wine and cheeses or enjoy some of the wonderful pasta dishes, the wild boar and tagliatelle pasta is amazing. Service is impeccable. Must make reservations!!!  Great for groups and the outside area is beautiful.

4.5 Stars

I've been asking my significant other to take me to Vintner Grill for a long time....and some how we always forget about this place when we have date night. Anyways, I finally made it on a busy Saturday night with reservations!! I've only been to Vintner for a wine event so I was really excited to try the food. We started off with some drinks....I ordered the Tropical Paradise I think that's the name....and let me tell you that drink alone will make me go back! 

For an appetizer, we started off with the 3 selection, 2 different cheese and prosciutto. Pretty delish! For dinner, I decided to order the scallops and the husband ordered the Chicken with Mac and Cheese. We decided to do a half order of the Bolognese Taglietelli! (I love that they can do half order for you). My scallops were good, but nothing to run home and Yelp about, the chicken and mac and cheese were definitely a better choice between the two. The pasta was delicious, but kind of tasted like chow fun (dry style). I liked how they had big chunks of lamb, but its definitely more Asian influenced, still delicious! We were too full with dinner to order some dessert, but I know we will be back! 

Service was good, the place was packed for a Saturday night and I can't wait to get the Tropical Paradise! YUM!!!!

I have always loved dining here... Very upscale, modern place, excellent ambiance. Very good selection of cheese and they always have  vegetarian and vegan choices in their ever changing menu. If you like wine, you will be pleased with their wine menu. They even have wine flights, the sparkling wine flight is my favorite. My husband and I have tried almost every dish on their menu and everything is just excellent!
I have always had excellent servers. I chose to dine here again for our anniversary. However we did not have a good service this visit and its all because of our server, Scott. He is very serious, no smile, no customer service of any kind. I hope the restaurant can take a note of his terrible manners. I would surely return to dine here but would always put in a request "please do not keep us on Scott's table"
I would give 5 stars to this place for the food and ambiance but I have to rate it 3 for the poor quality of service.
Get the seafood bouillabaisse. Lots of seafood in a flavorful broth served with pesto bread.
I love this place. Its beautiful, food to die for and in general good service.
Food was "OK". I ordered salmon & walnut salad. I wasn't too impressed. Atmosphere was nice; although I didn't have most pleasant waiter.
They have great food and a nice wine selection. It is hidden in an office complex. I did not know the place was there until I lived here for five years. Odd location.
I love this restaurant.  Love the atmosphere and the food.  My only complaint is they use bleach to clean, and I can always smell it when I arrive.

Where is this place? Its in an office complex that can be totally missed if you weren't looking for it. The decor inside and on the patio is pretty fantabuloso. We went here for my wife's bday and it was a blast. We scored the cool patio tent which made for an excellent evening outside with the Vegas heat cooling down (yet after a few glasses of wine you get heated up again) Word on the patio tent is first come first serve, or if you need it guaranteed for your dinner plans, plan to drop $1000 min to secure it. Otherwise anywhere else in the restaurant is still a nice experience. We were here on a sat night and to our surprise we got to enjoy a really cool band set up next to our tent. It was a very nice chillaxin vibe with good food and good company. 
The food was excellent and expect to pay 25 - 30+ for entrees. The only problem I had was with the initial reservation. I had called and made the reservation on a Tuesday, for a Saturday evening dinner. Luckily I called a few hours ahead to confirm reservations because they had no record of it!!!!! If I remember correctly, the initial girl I spoke with seemed really distracted taking my reservation and answering my questions, almost sounded annoyed. I was really disappointed with this. But luckily the nice girl who I spoke with the day of our reservation assured me she could fit us in and even made sure we scored the tent when we arrived. Much thanks for that. I forgot your name but you were the pretty, sexy, black girl with short hair at the front! The whole staff that night was pretty busy but still accommodating. The food, service and overall experience was great.

This is one of Summerlin's best kept secrets.  It's hidden off in an office park, so it's hard to locate unless you know about it.  I tried several dishes but my favorite is the Mediterranean Sea Bass and the cheese plate.  Any cheese is delicious here...

The waitstaff and ambiance is great.  Every time I have a visitor come in from out of town this is one of the first place I take them.  They love it!!!

A true hidden gem in Summerlin. ( in an office park off Charleston) weird! The patio area Wow. so so beautiful. A sexy, romantic, beautiful atmosphere, with soft music, gas fire pit, sofa seating. Oh and the food is Exceptional! Menu is sessional additions but listed below are always on the menu. 

Must try: 
-Cheese and meat boards. (They make their own cheese)
-Pizza flat breads. The burrata one is bomb
-The pan seared scallops 
-Braised Lamb Osso bucco (even if you don't like lamb) best dish ever! 
-The Beet salad. YUM!!

This is one of my go to places in my neighborhood.  It never disappoints.  Whether sitting at the bar having a cocktail and an appetizer, or sitting for a meal and a bottle of wine.  I simply love this place.  The atmosphere is fantastic, the menu is great for both food and wine/cocktails.  The bartenders are social and great at their jobs.  I tend to go here at least a few times a month and have for years.

We went to this restaurant for the first time last night.  It is now my new favorite "locals" (aka not on the strip) restaurant.  The ambiance of the place is unique with a very cool vibe (you'll just have to see it).  Their extensive cheese and wine selection can make for a long enjoyable dining experience.  We had a party of 5 and ordered two cheese plates with Stilton, Purple Haze, Humbolt Fog, Gruye, and White Cheddar.  All were delicious.  The starter crab cakes and hummus were excellent.  I don't plan to ever visit this restaurant without getting the crab cakes and hummus.  As an entrée, I loved the scallops and also got to try the veal which was awesome.  The service was excellent.  Overall, this restaurant is one of the best dining experiences I have had in Vegas.

You really can't say anything bad about Vintner Grill.  We've been going there for over 10 years.  It's one of the birthday or anniversary spots in the rotation.

Food and service are always on point.  There are some newer places in Summerlin that are as good, if not better now and are definitely more reasonable than Vintner Grill.   

So I think Vintner needs to step it up some and come strong with some new menu items.  The menu has been pretty consistent since we've been going there for many years.   A change of pace and cost that is more in line with some of the other fine dining establishments in Summerlin would serve them well.

Notice that the review is still 5 stars though, because it is a fine restaurant and there is something to be said about consistency.  I would just like to see them take some chances and spruce up the menu some.
